orestes.bloomfilter.memory

Class CountingBloomFilterMemory<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • orestes.bloomfilter.memory.CountingBloomFilterMemory<T>

extends java.lang.Object
implements CountingBloomFilter<T>

      • getEstimatedCount

        public long getEstimatedCount(T element)
        Description copied from interface: CountingBloomFilter
        Return the estimated count for an element using the Mininum Selection algorithm (i.e. by choosing the minimum counter for the given element). This estimation is biased, as it doest not consider how full the filter is, but performs best in practice. The underlying theoretical foundation are spectral Bloom filters, see: http://theory.stanford.edu/~matias/papers/sbf_thesis.pdf
        Specified by:
        getEstimatedCount in interface CountingBloomFilter<T>
        Parameters:
        element - element to query
        Returns:
        estimated count of the element

      • union

        public boolean union(BloomFilter<T> other)
        Description copied from interface: BloomFilter
        Performs the union operation on two compatible bloom filters. This is achieved through a bitwise OR operation on their bit vectors. This operations is lossless, i.e. no elements are lost and the bloom filter is the same that would have resulted if all elements wer directly inserted in just one bloom filter.
        Specified by:
        union in interface BloomFilter<T>
        Parameters:
        other - the other bloom filter
        Returns:
        true if this bloom filter could successfully be updated through the union with the provided bloom filter

      • intersect

        public boolean intersect(BloomFilter<T> other)
        Description copied from interface: BloomFilter
        Performs the intersection operation on two compatible bloom filters. This is achieved through a bitwise AND operation on their bit vectors. The operations doesn't introduce any false negatives but it does raise the false positive probability. The the false positive probability in the resulting Bloom filter is at most the false-positive probability in one of the constituent bloom filters
        Specified by:
        intersect in interface BloomFilter<T>
        Parameters:
        other - the other bloom filter
        Returns:
        true if this bloom filter could successfully be updated through the intersection with the provided bloom filter
